algorithmSettings.name: seed
algorithmSettings.description: Integer seed for random number generator

algorithmSettings.name: failed_f_value
algorithmSettings.description: Return Value for F(x) if F fails

arguments.name: weather_file_name
arguments.description: Name of the weather file to change to. This is the filename with the extension (e.g. NewWeather.epw). Optionally this can inclucde the full file path, but for most use cases should just be file name.

arguments.name: set_year
arguments.description: This will impact the day of the week the simulation starts on. An input value of 0 will leave the year un-altered

arguments.name: use_upstream_args
arguments.description: When true this will look for arguments or registerValues in upstream measures that match arguments from this measure, and will use the value from the upstream measure in place of what is entered for this measure.

measures.name: space_type_and_construction_set_wizard
measures.display_name: Space Type and Construction Set Wizard
measures.description: Create space types and or construction sets for the requested building type, climate zone, and target.
measures.modeler_description: The data for this measure comes from the openstudio-standards Ruby Gem. They are no longer created from the same JSON file that was used to make the OpenStudio templates. Optionally this will also set the building default space type and construction set.

arguments.name: set_building_defaults
arguments.display_name: Set Building Defaults Using New Objects?

measures.name: bar_aspect_ratio_study
measures.description: This measure will create a building envelope based on a target floor area, aspect ratio, and floor to floor height.
measures.modeler_description: This is based on the SketchUp Plugin user script to create a rectangular building, but just uses different inputs. The resulting building will have a core and perimeter zoning, unless it is too small, in which case eac floor will have a single zone.

arguments.name: ns_to_ew_ratio
arguments.display_name: Ratio of North/South Facade Length Relative to East/West Facade Length.

measures.name: rotate_building
measures.description: Rotate your building relative to its current orientation. This will not rotate site shading objects.
measures.modeler_description: Get the North Axis field for the  OS:Building object and adjusted it based on the user specified value. If the starting value is 20 degrees and the user value is 5 degrees, then the resulting value is 25 degrees.

arguments.name: relative_building_rotation
arguments.display_name: Number of Degrees to Rotate Building (positive value is clockwise).

measures.name: aedg_small_to_medium_office_fenestration_and_daylighting_controls
measures.description: This measure will remove all existing exterior windows, glass doors, and skylights from your model. They will be replaced with view and daylight windows as recommended by the Small to Medium Office AEDG recommendations. Windows on the south facade will have a exterior shading or light shelf surfaces depending on if they are view or daylight windows. East and west view windows will have internal shading controls. In spaces with daylighting controls daylight sensor will be added. The modeler should inspect where the sensors were placed, the recommended illuminance setpoint, and the fraction of the zones lighting controlled by the sensor.
measures.modeler_description: This measure is intended for use in models created form space types defined in the office building types. Fenestration will be added to all spaces with exterior walls except for spaces not included in the floor area. This should include attic and plenum spaces. Daylighting will only be added to north and south facades. North and south facades can be +/- 30 degrees of north and south. East and west facades will only receive view windows. The daylight sensor's depth in from the wall will typically be the same as the height of the wall that the daylight windows is on. This depth is also what is used to calculate the daylight fraction of the space. In spaces that are non convex, such as an L shaped space, we may not be able to place a sensor, if that happens a warning will be issued.

arguments.name: cost_daylight_glazing
arguments.display_name: Cost per Area for Proposed Daylighting Window Constructions ($/ft^2).

arguments.name: cost_view_glazing
arguments.display_name: Cost per Area for Proposed View Window Constructions ($/ft^2).

arguments.name: cost_skylight
arguments.display_name: Cost per Area for Proposed Skylight Construction ($/ft^2).

arguments.name: cost_shading_surface
arguments.display_name: Cost per Area for Proposed Exterior Shading Surface Construction ($/ft^2).

arguments.name: cost_light_shelf
arguments.display_name: Cost per Area for Proposed Light Shelf Construction ($/ft^2).

measures.name: reduce_lighting_loads_by_percentage
measures.description: The lighting system in this building uses more power per area than is required with the latest lighting technologies.  Replace the lighting system with a newer, more efficient lighting technology.  Newer technologies provide the same amount of light but use less energy in the process.
measures.modeler_description: This measure supports models which have a mixture of lighting assigned to spaces and space types.  The lighting may be specified as individual luminaires, lighting equipment level, lighting power per area, or lighting power per person. Loop through all lights and luminaires in the specified space type or the entire building. Clone the definition if it is shared by other lights, rename and adjust the power based on the specified percentage. Link the new definition to the existing lights or luminaire instance.  Adjust the power for lighting equipment assigned to a particular space but only if that space is part of the selected space type by  looping through the objects first in space types and then in spaces, but again only for spaces that are in the specified space type (unless the entire building has been chosen).  Material and installation cost increases will be applied to all costs related to both the definition and instance of the lighting object.  If this measure includes baseline costs, then the material and installation costs of the lighting objects in the baseline model will be summed together and added as a capital cost on the building object.

arguments.name: space_type
arguments.display_name: Apply the Measure to a Specific Space Type or to the Entire Model

arguments.name: material_and_installation_cost
arguments.display_name: Increase in Material and Installation Cost for Lighting per Floor Area

arguments.name: demolition_cost
arguments.display_name: Increase in Demolition Costs for Lighting per Floor Area

arguments.name: demo_cost_initial_const
arguments.display_name: Demolition Costs Occur During Initial Construction

arguments.name: om_cost
arguments.display_name: Increase O & M Costs for Lighting per Floor Area

measures.name: reduce_space_infiltration_by_percentage
measures.description: This measure will reduce space infiltration rates by the requested percentage. A cost per square foot of building area can be added to the model.
measures.modeler_description: This can be run across a space type or the entire building. Costs will be associated with the building. If infiltration objects are removed at a later date, the costs will remain.

arguments.name: space_type
arguments.display_name: Apply the Measure to a Specific Space Type or to the Entire Model.

arguments.name: alter_coef
arguments.display_name: Alter constant temperature and wind speed coefficients.
arguments.description: Setting this to false will result in infiltration objects that maintain the coefficients from the initial model. Setting this to true replaces the existing coefficients with the values entered for the coefficient arguments in this measure

arguments.name: material_and_installation_cost
arguments.display_name: Increase in Material and Installation Costs for Building per Affected Floor Area

arguments.name: om_cost
arguments.display_name: O & M Costs for Construction per Affected Floor Area

measures.name: reduce_electric_equipment_loads_by_percentage
measures.display_name: Reduce Electric Equipment Loads by Percentage
measures.description:
Reduce Electric Equipment Loads by Percentage</display_name>
  <description>Reduce electric equipment loads. This will affect equipment that have a, power, power per area (LPD), or power per person value. This can be applied to the entire building or a specific space type. A positive percentage represents an increase electric equipment power, while a negative percentage can be used for an increase in electric equipment power.
measures.modeler_description: Loop through all electric equipment objects in the specified space type or the entire building. Clone the definition if it has not already been cloned, rename and adjust the power based on the specified percentage. Link the new definition to the existing electric equipment instance. Loop through objects first in space types and then in spaces, but only for spaces that are in the specified space type, unless entire building has been chosen.

arguments.name: space_type
arguments.display_name: Apply the Measure to a Specific Space Type or to the Entire Model

arguments.name: material_and_installation_cost
arguments.display_name: Increase in Material and Installation Cost for Electric Equipment per Floor Area

arguments.name: demolition_cost
arguments.display_name: Increase in Demolition Costs for Electric Equipment per Floor Area

arguments.name: demo_cost_initial_const
arguments.display_name: Demolition Costs Occur During Initial Construction

arguments.name: om_cost
arguments.display_name: Increase O & M Costs for Electric Equipment per Floor Area

measures.name: set_thermostat_schedules
measures.description: Sets zone thermostat schedules to schedules in the same file. If a zone does not have a thermostat this measure will add one
measures.modeler_description: Sets zone thermostat schedules to schedules in the same file. If a zone does not have a thermostat this measure will add one.

arguments.name: zones
arguments.display_name: Choose Thermal Zones to change thermostat schedules on.

arguments.name: material_cost
arguments.display_name: Material and Installation Costs per Thermal Zone ($/thermal zone).

measures.name: adjust_thermostat_setpoints_by_degrees
measures.description: This measure adjusts heating and cooling setpoints by a user specified number of degrees. This is applied throughout the entire building.
measures.modeler_description: This measure will clone all of the schedules that are used as heating and cooling setpoints for thermal zones. The clones are hooked up to the thermostat in place of the original schedules. Then the schedules are adjusted by the specified values. There is a checkbox to determine if the thermostat for design days should be altered.

arguments.name: cooling_adjustment
arguments.display_name: Degrees Fahrenheit to Adjust Cooling Setpoint By

arguments.name: heating_adjustment
arguments.display_name: Degrees Fahrenheit to Adjust heating Setpoint By

measures.name: nze_hvac
measures.description: This measure replaces the existing HVAC system if any with the user selected HVAC system.  The user can select how to partition the system, applying it to the whole building, a system per building type, a system per building story, or automatically partition based on residential/non-residential occupany types and space loads.
measures.modeler_description: HVAC system creation logic uses [openstudio-standards](https://github.com/NREL/openstudio-standards) and efficiency values are defined in the openstudio-standards Standards spreadsheet under the *NREL ZNE Ready 2017* template.

arguments.name: hvac_system_type
arguments.description: Details on HVAC system type in measure documentation.
choice_values: Ground Source Heat Pumps with DOAS
Ground Source Heat Pumps with DOAS with DCV
Fan Coils with DOAS with DCV
choice_display_names: Ground Source Heat Pumps with DOAS
Ground Source Heat Pumps with DOAS with DCV
Fan Coils with DOAS with DCV

choiceDisplayNames: Ground Source Heat Pumps with DOAS
Ground Source Heat Pumps with DOAS with DCV
Fan Coils with DOAS with DCV

arguments.name: hvac_system_partition
arguments.description: Automatic Partition will separate the HVAC system by residential/non-residential and if loads and schedules are substantially different.

measures.name: add_rooftop_pv
measures.description: This measure will create new shading surface geometry above the roof for each thermal zone inyour model where the surface azmith falls within the user specified range. Arguments are exposed for panel efficiency, inverter efficiency, and the fraction of each roof surface that has PV.
measures.modeler_description: The fraction of surface containing PV will not only set the PV properties, but will also change the transmittance value for the shading surface. This allows the measure to avoid attempting to layout the panels. Simple PV will be used to model the PV.

arguments.name: fraction_of_surface
arguments.display_name: Fraction of Surface Area with Active Solar Cells

measures.name: view_model
measures.description: Visualize an OpenStudio model in a web based viewer
measures.modeler_description: Converts the OpenStudio model to vA3C JSON format and renders using Three.js

measures.name: envelope_and_internal_load_breakdown
measures.description: Report provides annual and monthly views into heat gains and losses for envelope and internal loads.
measures.modeler_description: It uses the following variables: Electric Equipment Total Heating Energy, Zone Lights Total Heating Energy, Zone, People Sensible Heating Energy, Surface Average Face Conduction Heat Transfer Energy, Surface Window Heat Gain Energy, Surface Window Heat Loss Energy, Zone Infiltration Sensible Heat Gain Energy, Zone Infiltration Sensible Heat Loss Energy. For Surface Average Face Conduction Heat Transfer Energy bin positive values as heat gain and negative values as heat loss.

measures.name: openstudio_results
measures.description: This measure creates high level tables and charts pulling both from model inputs and EnergyPlus results. It has building level information as well as detail on space types, thermal zones, HVAC systems, envelope characteristics, and economics. Click the heading above a chart to view a table of the chart data.
measures.modeler_description: For the most part consumption data comes from the tabular EnergyPlus results, however there are a few requests added for time series results. Space type and loop details come from the OpenStudio model. The code for this is modular, making it easy to use as a template for your own custom reports. The structure of the report uses bootstrap, and the graphs use dimple js.

arguments.name: units
arguments.display_name: Which Unit System do you want to use?

arguments.name: reg_monthly_details
arguments.display_name: Report monthly fuel and enduse breakdown to registerValue
arguments.description: This argument does not effect HTML file, instead it makes data from individal cells of monthly tables avaiable for machine readable values in the resulting OpenStudio Workflow file.
